intro: Jacquemontia tuerckheimii, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and twining. Jacquemontia tuerckheimii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
